content:
SendPacketsElement Class

In this Article

Represents an element in a SendPacketsElement array.

Syntax

Declaration

public class SendPacketsElement

Inheritance Hierarchy

  • System.Object
  • SendPacketsElement

Inherited Members

Equals(Object)
,
Equals(Object,Object)
,
GetHashCode()
,
GetType()
,
MemberwiseClone()
,
ReferenceEquals(Object,Object)
,
ToString()

Remarks

The SendPacketsElement class is used to enhance the Socket class for use by server applications that use asynchronous network I/O to achieve the highest performance. The SendPacketsElement class is used with the SendPacketsElements property to get or set a data buffer or file to be sent using the SendPacketsAsync method.

Constructors summary

SendPacketsElement(Byte[])

Initializes a new instance of the SendPacketsElement class using the specified buffer.
SendPacketsElement(String)

Initializes a new instance of the SendPacketsElement class using the specified file.
SendPacketsElement(Byte[],Int32,Int32)

Initializes a new instance of the SendPacketsElement class using the specified buffer, buffer offset, and count.
SendPacketsElement(String,Int32,Int32)

Initializes a new instance of the SendPacketsElement class using the specified filename path, offset, and count.
SendPacketsElement(Byte[],Int32,Int32,Boolean)

Initializes a new instance of the SendPacketsElement class using the specified buffer, buffer offset, and count with an option to combine this element with the next element in a single send request from the sockets layer to the transport.
SendPacketsElement(String,Int32,Int32,Boolean)

Initializes a new instance of the SendPacketsElement class using the specified filename path, buffer offset, and count with an option to combine this element with the next element in a single send request from the sockets layer to the transport.

Properties summary

Buffer

Gets the buffer to be sent if the SendPacketsElement class was initialized with a buffer parameter.
Count

Gets the count of bytes to be sent.
EndOfPacket

Gets a Boolean value that indicates if this element should not be combined with the next element in a single send request from the sockets layer to the transport.
FilePath

Gets the filename of the file to send if the SendPacketsElement class was initialized with a filepath parameter.
Offset

Gets the offset, in bytes, from the beginning of the data buffer or file to the location in the buffer or file to start sending the data.

Constructors

  • SendPacketsElement(Byte[])

    Initializes a new instance of the SendPacketsElement class using the specified buffer.

    public SendPacketsElement (byte[] buffer);

    Parameters

    • buffer
      Byte[]

      A byte array of data to send using the stem.Net.Sockets.Socket.SendPacketsAsync* method.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentNullException

      The buffer parameter cannot be null

    Remarks

    The SendPacketsElement constructor initializes a new instance of the SendPacketsElement class with a byte array of data. The SendPacketsElement class is used with the SendPacketsElements property to get or set a data buffer or file to be sent using the SendPacketsAsync method.

  • SendPacketsElement(String)

    Initializes a new instance of the SendPacketsElement class using the specified file.

    public SendPacketsElement (string filepath);

    Parameters

    • filepath
      String

      The filename of the file to be transmitted using the stem.Net.Sockets.Socket.SendPacketsAsync* method.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentNullException

      The filepath parameter cannot be null

    Remarks

    The SendPacketsElement constructor initializes a new instance of the SendPacketsElement class with a filename of a file. The SendPacketsElement class is used with the SendPacketsElements property to get or set a data buffer or file to be sent using the SendPacketsAsync method.

    Universal Naming Convention (UNC) paths are supported by the filepath parameter. If the file is in the current working directory, no path information needs to be specified.

  • SendPacketsElement(Byte[],Int32,Int32)

    Initializes a new instance of the SendPacketsElement class using the specified buffer, buffer offset, and count.

    public SendPacketsElement (byte[] buffer, int offset, int count);

    Parameters

    • buffer
      Byte[]

      A byte array of data to send using the stem.Net.Sockets.Socket.SendPacketsAsync* method.

    • offset
      Int32

      The offset, in bytes, from the beginning of the buffer to the location in the buffer to start sending the data specified in the buffer parameter.

    • count
      Int32

      The number of bytes to send starting from the offset parameter. If count is zero, no bytes are sent.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentNullException

      The buffer parameter cannot be null

    • ArgumentOutOfRangeException

      The offset and count parameters must be greater than or equal to zero.

      The offset and count must be less than the size of the buffer

    Remarks

    The SendPacketsElement constructor initializes a new instance of the SendPacketsElement class with a byte array of data. The SendPacketsElement class is used with the SendPacketsElements property to get or set a data buffer or file to be sent using the SendPacketsAsync method.

  • SendPacketsElement(String,Int32,Int32)

    Initializes a new instance of the SendPacketsElement class using the specified filename path, offset, and count.

    public SendPacketsElement (string filepath, int offset, int count);

    Parameters

    • filepath
      String

      The filename of the file to be transmitted using the stem.Net.Sockets.Socket.SendPacketsAsync* method.

    • offset
      Int32

      The offset, in bytes, from the beginning of the file to the location in the file to start sending the file specified in the filepath parameter.

    • count
      Int32

      The number of bytes to send starting from the offset parameter. If count is zero, the entire file is sent.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentNullException

      The filepath parameter cannot be null

    • ArgumentOutOfRangeException

      The offset and count parameters must be greater than or equal to zero.

      The offset and count must be less than the size of the file indicated by the filepath parameter.

    Remarks

    The SendPacketsElement constructor initializes a new instance of the SendPacketsElement class with a filename of a file. The SendPacketsElement class is used with the SendPacketsElements property to get or set a data buffer or file to be sent using the SendPacketsAsync method.

    Universal Naming Convention (UNC) paths are supported by the filepath parameter. If the file is in the current working directory, no path information needs to be specified.

  • SendPacketsElement(Byte[],Int32,Int32,Boolean)

    Initializes a new instance of the SendPacketsElement class using the specified buffer, buffer offset, and count with an option to combine this element with the next element in a single send request from the sockets layer to the transport.

    public SendPacketsElement (byte[] buffer, int offset, int count, bool endOfPacket);

    Parameters

    • buffer
      Byte[]

      A byte array of data to send using the stem.Net.Sockets.Socket.SendPacketsAsync* method.

    • offset
      Int32

      The offset, in bytes, from the beginning of the buffer to the location in the buffer to start sending the data specified in the buffer parameter.

    • count
      Int32

      The number bytes to send starting from the offset parameter. If count is zero, no bytes are sent.

    • endOfPacket
      Boolean

      A Boolean value that specifies that this element should not be combined with the next element in a single send request from the sockets layer to the transport. This flag is used for granular control of the content of each message on a datagram or message-oriented socket.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentNullException

      The buffer parameter cannot be null

    • ArgumentOutOfRangeException

      The offset and count parameters must be greater than or equal to zero.

      The offset and count must be less than the size of the buffer

    Remarks

    The SendPacketsElement constructor initializes a new instance of the SendPacketsElement class with a byte array of data. The SendPacketsElement class is used with the SendPacketsElements property to get or set a data buffer or file to be sent using the SendPacketsAsync method.

  • SendPacketsElement(String,Int32,Int32,Boolean)

    Initializes a new instance of the SendPacketsElement class using the specified filename path, buffer offset, and count with an option to combine this element with the next element in a single send request from the sockets layer to the transport.

    public SendPacketsElement (string filepath, int offset, int count, bool endOfPacket);

    Parameters

    • filepath
      String

      The filename of the file to be transmitted using the stem.Net.Sockets.Socket.SendPacketsAsync* method.

    • offset
      Int32

      The offset, in bytes, from the beginning of the file to the location in the file to start sending the file specified in the filepath parameter.

    • count
      Int32

      The number of bytes to send starting from the offset parameter. If count is zero, the entire file is sent.

    • endOfPacket
      Boolean

      A Boolean value that specifies that this element should not be combined with the next element in a single send request from the sockets layer to the transport. This flag is used for granular control of the content of each message on a datagram or message-oriented socket.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentNullException

      The filepath parameter cannot be null

    • ArgumentOutOfRangeException

      The offset and count parameters must be greater than or equal to zero.

      The offset and count must be less than the size of the file indicated by the filepath parameter.

    Remarks

    The SendPacketsElement constructor initializes a new instance of the SendPacketsElement class with a filename of a file. The SendPacketsElement class is used with the SendPacketsElements property to get or set a data buffer or file to be sent using the SendPacketsAsync method.

    Universal Naming Convention (UNC) paths are supported by the filepath parameter. If the file is in the current working directory, no path information needs to be specified.

Properties

  • Buffer

    Gets the buffer to be sent if the SendPacketsElement class was initialized with a buffer parameter.

    public byte[] Buffer { get; }

    Property Value

    • Byte[]

      The byte buffer to send if the SendPacketsElement class was initialized with a buffer parameter.

    Remarks

    The default value for the Buffer property is a zero-length array if the SendPacketsElement class was not initialized with a buffer parameter.

  • Count

    Gets the count of bytes to be sent.

    public int Count { get; }

    Property Value

    • Int32

      The count of bytes to send if the SendPacketsElement class was initialized with a count parameter.

    Remarks

    The default value for the Count property is zero if the SendPacketsElement class was not initialized with a count parameter.

    If Count is zero for a file, the entire file is sent. If Count is zero for a buffer, no bytes are sent.

  • EndOfPacket

    Gets a Boolean value that indicates if this element should not be combined with the next element in a single send request from the sockets layer to the transport.

    public bool EndOfPacket { get; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      A Boolean value that indicates if this element should not be combined with the next element in a single send request.

    Remarks

    The default value for the EndOfPacket property is false if the SendPacketsElement class was not initialized with an endOfPacket parameter set to true.

  • FilePath

    Gets the filename of the file to send if the SendPacketsElement class was initialized with a filepath parameter.

    public string FilePath { get; }

    Property Value

    • String

      The filename of the file to send if the SendPacketsElement class was initialized with a filepath parameter.

    Remarks

    Universal Naming Convention (UNC) paths are supported by the FilePath property. If the file is in the current working directory, no path information needs to be specified.

    The default value for the FilePath property is an empty string if the SendPacketsElement class was not initialized with a filepath parameter.

  • Offset

    Gets the offset, in bytes, from the beginning of the data buffer or file to the location in the buffer or file to start sending the data.

    public int Offset { get; }

    Property Value

    • Int32

      The offset, in bytes, from the beginning of the data buffer or file to the location in the buffer or file to start sending the data.

    Remarks

    The default value for the Offset property is zero if the SendPacketsElement class was not initialized with an offset parameter.
